plainText
The function is designed to clean up text formatting by removing HTML tags from the text.
Syntax
plainText
(text)
Setting
Purpose
text
The text (string) to be converted.
Text can be provided by, for example,
attr
,
alg
,
param
,
var
,
attrByVar
,
calcTemplate
functions.
Note
The function is called from the
"Text" tab
toolbar of the algorithm editor.
When the function works:
the contents of <script></script> and <style></style> tags will be ignored;
CSS styles and attributes of HTML tags are not considered;
meta information (meta tags) is not processed.
Use example
It is required to retrieve the contents of a notification template and write the value to a text attribute ( with no complex formatting support) for further use and to make edits to the text if necessary.
Imagine that there is a customized object type containing the following attributes:
“Notification template” - an
object attribute
referring to the
“Notification template”
[SYS_EMAIL_NOTIFICATION] object type to select the customized template.
“Mail text” - an attribute of the “Text” type with
"Multiline input" visual
to insert text from a template.
There is also a customized notification template for the current special offer, where formatting is applied to the message text:
To achieve this task, create the “Past text from template”
custom action
calling
algorithm
, which uses the
plainText
function to clean up text formatting:
Read more about the algorithm.
the “template” variable is declared using the
var
function;
the
calcTemplate
function retrieves the message text (“BODY”) from the notification template contained in the “Notification template” attribute, with the template calculation based on the current object (
currentObject
);
using the
attr
function with the “Set value” attribute, the message text from the template, cleaned from formatting by the
plainText
function, is written to the “Mail text” attribute;
adding the “Notification template” and “Mail text” attributes is done using the
attr
function.
To trigger the action, place the
“Button”
widget on the visual.
As a result of customization, when selecting a template in the “Notification template” field and pressing the “Paste text from template” button, the message text will be inserted into the “Mail text” attribute and can be edited if necessary:
